decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana using Cloudposts and various mana acceleration cards to cast powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures and Planeswalkers, overwhelming the opponent with large threats and disruption. The deck also utilizes Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's spells and disrupt their game plan, while Voltaic Key provides additional utility. The deck focuses on assembling its mana base quickly and efficiently to bring out its high-impact threats, taking advantage of the powerful synergy between the Cloudpost lands and mana acceleration artifacts.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to utilize powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by ramp cards like Cloudpost and Eldrazi Temple. The deck aims to quickly bring out big threats to overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck also includes removal options like All is Dust and Walking Ballista to deal with opposing threats. By efficiently ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures, this deck seeks to dominate the battlefield and secure a quick victory.

Utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to deploy threats quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a focus on efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary, along with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Swords of Fire and Ice, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Stoneforge Mystic to find key pieces, the deck can adapt to various matchups and quickly close out games.

This deck revolves around using Cloudpost and ramping up mana generation to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm and control the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Sorcerous Spyglass and Karn, the Great Creator provide utility and flexibility in dealing with various threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and control the game through mana advantage and powerful creatures.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, card advantage, and efficient removal. By using powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic, along with equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control, while cards like Palace Jailer and Council's Judgment help deal with problematic permanents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to cast its spells efficiently and effectively control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, along with disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, to apply early pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The deck also incorporates efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Cratermaker to deal with opposing threats. The mana denial strategy is further supported by cards like Wasteland and Stifle, allowing the deck to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain tempo advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with cards like Wasteland and Thalia's taxing effect. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords of Light and Shadow/Fire and Ice to enhance the creatures' abilities. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to colored mana sources and includes utility lands like Karakas and Gaea's Cradle to support the aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using disruptive creatures like Thalia and Phyrexian Revoker, as well as taxing lands with Wasteland and Rishadan Port. It also aims to efficiently deploy powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull through Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial. The combination of aggressive creature threats like Serra Avenger and resilient threats like Flickerwisp, along with disruptive elements, creates a versatile and challenging strategy for opponents to navigate. Ultimately, the goal is to control the tempo of the game and apply pressure to secure victory.

The main concept of this Cloudpost Ramp deck is to quickly generate massive amounts of mana through cards like Glimmerpost, Cloudpost, and Thran Dynamo, allowing you to cast powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to disrupt opponents' strategies and slow down their game plan. The combination of ramp and disruptive elements makes this deck a formidable force in the Legacy format, enabling you to dominate the battlefield and overwhelm your opponents with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board while quickly deploying aggressive threats like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets. It also includes card advantage engines like Dreadhorde Arcanist and can put pressure on the opponent's life total with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to be proactive and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast clock. With a mix of card selection, counterspells, and removal, it can adapt to different matchups and playstyles in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to hinder opponents' spells, while cards like Walking Ballista provide flexible removal options. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Karakas allows for additional disruption against opponent's lands and key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt opponents' game plan to secure a fast victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo quickly and efficiently. This involves using cards like Crop Rotation and Vampire Hexmage to remove the ice counters from Dark Depths and create the 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's hand. Additionally, cards like Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library help with card advantage and consistency. With a mix of removal, card draw, and combo pieces, the deck aims to win the game in a swift and decisive manner.

The main concept of this Combo - Show and Tell deck is to cheat powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play as quickly as possible using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to manipulate the deck and find the necessary combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes countermagic like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of disruption and card advantage. By utilizing powerful spells like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and generating incremental advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats while also having access to versatile cards like Baleful Strix for additional value.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with efficient counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Brainstorm and Counterbalance, while also taking advantage of card advantage through Snapcaster Mage and Narset, Parter of Veils. Lastly, the deck includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Terminus to deal with threats on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on control and card advantage, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has a solid removal suite with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Abrupt Decay, as well as recurring removal with Punishing Fire. It aims to grind out value with cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, while also utilizing powerful land synergies with Grove of the Burnwillows and Leovold, Emissary of Trest.
